title: New Client Error - "The instruction at referenced memory"
body:
Hello everyone!

Yesterday I connected new (additional) Hard Drive to my PC. My bad I didn't format it fully (it was still having Windows 10 which I used on Laptop). It a little bit bugged my OS. I had to reenter FolderDescriptions registry records (couldn't cut-paste or rename folders) and do clean installation of .NET and nVidia Driver (GTX960 STRIX here). They were in the newest possible versions of course. Since then I can't run LoL new client. Error (below) occurs every time I launch new client (after double-clicking on icon or from legacy Launcher). I made up workaround for now (RADS\system\user.cfg: leagueClientOptIn = yes -> no) to use legacy client (no problem with it), but Riot is going to discontinue support of it, so I need a solution.  Any ideas how to fix it? I tried all my own and failed.

Thanks in advance,
Mark00s.

//Error translated to English
LolClient.exe - Application Error

The instruction at /* memory cell ID */ referenced memory at /* memory cell ID */.The memory could not be ''read''.

Click on OK to terminate the program
Click on Cancel to debug program (I can debug it in Visual Studio)

replies.body: Fixed. Can be closed. I've just made "soft format" (booting Windows installation disc and hitting 'upgrade' instead of 'advanced').

You are correct, but LoL was installed on (already) connected disk, old 64GB SSD I use for small games. I reinstalled it twice already, but all of them wasn't default location. I'll try install it in default, but I am not sure if it helps.

So if I'm understanding you correctly, you pulled this hard drive from a laptop and added it to your new desktop PC and installed League on it **without** formatting it from all previous files first? The error you've mentioned usually only crops up if an installation of League has gone wrong. I recommend reinstalling Leauge by following [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) to a T, including installing League to the default directory of C:\Riot Games.

Let me know if this resolved your error.
